summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 34840, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the changing and establishing of the curb grades of Forty-third Avenue Northeast, from East Forty-fourth Street to East Forty-fifth Street; and of East Forty-fifth Street, from Forty-second Avenue Northeast to Forty-fifth Avenue Northeast, and approaches thereto; providing for the condemnation, appropriation, taking and damaging of land and other property necessary for the grading and regrading of said avenue and street, and approaches thereto, in conformity with such established grades, and for cuts and fills upon the property abutting upon said avenue, street and approaches thereto, and providing that the entire cost of said improvement shall be paid by special assessment upon the property specially benefited in the manner provided by law," approved June 9, 1915, and published June 14, 1915.
